description: The fallout from Representative Aaron Schock’s “Downton Abbey”- inspired office continues.
title: The New York Times
title_page: Schock Says 'Haters Gonna Hate' on Office Decor - First Draft. Political News, Now. - The New York Times
text:
The fallout from Representative Aaron Schock’s “Downton Abbey”- inspired office continues.
Stopped in the halls of Congress by ABC’s Jeff Zeleny, Mr. Schock invoked the pop star Taylor Swift to sum up the controversy.
“Haters gonna hate,” Mr. Schock said.
The Washington Post reported that Mr. Schock, Republican of Illinois, has said that he will pay for the work done by an Illinois decorator who had offered to do it for free.
First Draft reported this morning that, paradoxically, Mr. Schock had voted to cut off federal financing for PBS, the network that broadcasts the British series in the United States, by supporting Representative Paul D. Ryan’s budget plan.
An earlier version of this post misspelled the surname of the congressman who quoted Taylor Swift. It is Aaron Schock, not Shock.
